article: One's education starts from family, especially from his or her mother. Here is a story  _  happened in my childhood. One Saturday morning, I was watching TV in the living room with my two brothers. My mum  _  several apples of different colors and sizes. She put all the apples on the table, then  _  me and my younger brothers, "Which do you like ?"  _  my younger brothers and I wanted the biggest one.  _  I could say " The biggest one", one of my brothers stood up and said what I wanted to say. My mum  picked up  the biggest apple and said to us, "It is  _  to get the biggest apple. Many people want the best thing, but few really get it. Now let's start a  _  . Look at the lawn in front of our  _  . I'll divide it into three parts. Each of you must finish pruning  _  own share. The best and quickest one will be  _  the biggest apple." I won the apple finally. Since then, I have learned to try my best to succeed whenever I get a chance. I work  _  to get what I want. That was what my mother advised me to do. I feel very thankful to my mum because she taught me a very basic but the most  _  lesson. It is quite fair that we can get what we want  _  competing . My mother kept teaching us in this way and we followed her  _  all the time. I do believe that mother is the first teacher of children, who can teach them to be a No.1 pursuing person.
